Radha Devi Jageshwari Memorial Medical College and Hospital is a private medical college and hospital located in Muzaffarpur, Bihar, India. Established in 2021, it is the first private medical college in Muzaffarpur. The institution offers undergraduate medical education, including the MBBS (Bachelor of Medicine and Bachelor of Surgery) program, with an annual intake capacity of 150 students.
The college is affiliated with the Bihar University of Health Sciences and recognized by the National Medical Commission. It operates a 950+ bed multispecialty hospital equipped with modern medical facilities and major diagnostic and therapeutic equipment. The college has a team of over 300 experienced faculty members and doctors, providing both academic training and clinical care.
MBBS (Bachelor of Medicine and Bachelor of Surgery)
Bachelor of Medicine and Bachelor of Surgery (MBBS) is an undergraduate medical degree offered at [Institute Name], affiliated with the Bihar University of Health Sciences and regulated by the National Medical Commission (NMC), previously known as the Medical Council of India. The program provides comprehensive training in medical sciences, integrating pre-clinical, para-clinical, and clinical education over a period of 4½ years, followed by a compulsory 1-year internship. The annual intake for the course is 150 students.
Duration
The MBBS course consists of 4½ years of academic study followed by a 1-year compulsory internship.
Curriculum
The curriculum is divided into three major phases: pre-clinical, para-clinical, and clinical.
Pre-Clinical Phase (First MBBS / Phase I)
Duration: 2 semesters (13 months)
Subjects: Human anatomy, Physiology, Biochemistry, Introduction to Community medicine, Humanities, and Professional Development including the AETCOM module.
Focus: Early clinical exposure with horizontal and vertical integration of subjects.
Para-Clinical Phase (Second MBBS / Phase II)
Duration: 2 semesters (12 months)
Subjects: Pathology, Pharmacology, Microbiology, Community Medicine, Forensic medicine, and Toxicology, along with continued AETCOM training.
Focus: Introduction to clinical subjects and continued training in ethics, communication, and professional skills.
Clinical Phase (Final MBBS / Phase III)
Duration: 5 semesters (28 months)
*Part I (13 months): Clinical subjects include General medicine, General surgery, Obstetrics, Gynecology, Pediatrics, Orthopedics, Dermatology, Otorhinolaryngology, Ophthalmology, Psychiatry, Respiratory medicine, Radiology, Radiotherapy, and Anaesthesiology. Professional development continues with AETCOM.
*Electives (2 months): Opportunities for research, community projects, and self-directed learning to encourage enquiry and lateral thinking.
*Part II (13 months): Advanced clinical training in Medicine and allied specialties, Surgery and allied specialties, Obstetrics & Gynecology, Pediatrics, and continued AETCOM modules.
Internship
After completing the academic curriculum, students undergo a 1-year compulsory internship, rotating through various clinical departments to gain practical experience in patient care.
Departments and Staff
The institution is organized into various administrative, academic, and clinical departments to ensure efficient management and high-quality medical education and healthcare services. These departments are broadly categorized into administrative, pre-clinical, para-clinical, clinical, and staff divisions, each playing a crucial role in the overall functioning of the medical college and hospital.
